revised_title: Coal-Dust and Colliery Explosions: Experiments and Observations
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the behavior of coal-dust in colliery explosions. They found that coal-dust can be ignited by fire-damp explosions, causing the flame to travel further and be self-sustaining. The author also observed that proper ventilation and preventing the accumulation of coal-dust can help prevent such accidents. These findings can help improve mine safety and prevent future colliery explosions.
